entries.content: Frame value against common industry bottlenecks: reluctance to prospect, wimpy calls, quick discounting, quoting and hoping.
entries.notes: Positions the service as solving prevalent problems without attacking specific competitors.

entries.content: Challenge common industry practices (e.g., free quoting) to highlight an alternative value proposition.
entries.notes: Creates intrigue and frames a different approach as potentially more valuable.

entries.content: Differentiate your approach (conversational, professional) from negative cold call stereotypes without naming specific competitors.
entries.notes: Positions the interaction as superior to typical bad experiences.

entries.content: Mentioning previous training was 'a bit American' as a point of contrast in style.
entries.notes: A subtle way to differentiate approach based on cultural style, not direct competitor critique.

entries.content: Be comfortable challenging prospects on their current practices or assumptions to open dialogue about alternative, potentially better, approaches.
entries.notes: Underpins the technique of challenging common practices.

focus_area: Competitive Objections: Unique value framing without attacking others
